definition: (coll.) promising/likely to turn out well
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]
variant of 戲|戏[xi4]

sentences.english: Bart really cleaned up in the card game.
sentences.chinese: 巴特在纸牌有戏中大获全胜。

sentences.english: Are there not mockers with me? and doth not mine eye continue in their provocation?
sentences.chinese: 真有戏笑我的在我这里，我眼常见他们惹动我。

sentences.english: I thought you two were becoming an item.
EFS Key is gathering required information from Master File Table. This could take some time.
sentences.chinese: 看来有戏，正在收集信息分析加密过的文件。

sentences.english: With the additional of contrast, shadow, colors, a simple matchstick man can be very dramatic.
sentences.chinese: 加上了光影，色彩，简单的火柴人就变得很有戏了。

sentences.english: The next millionaire seemed more promising.
sentences.chinese: 接下来这个富豪，看上去有戏。
杰尼斯肯斯立马知道搜寻有戏了。

definition: (coll.) not a chance/no way/hopeless
trick/drama/play/show/CL:齣|出[chu1],場|场[chang3],臺|台[tai2]
variant of 戲|戏[xi4]
qualities that make sth worth seeing (or reading)
in time with (i.e. same rhythm)/to keep in step with/fig. to cooperate
to strike while the iron is hot
(coll.) worthwhile/likely to be fruitful
(of an actor) to inhabit one's role/to become the character/(of an audience) to get involved in the drama
large-scale Chinese opera/Beijing opera/major dramatic production (movie, TV series etc)
(of a play, movie etc) to begin
boring/of no interest
item (on a program)
to put on a play/to perform/fig. to pretend/to feign
In order to capture, one must let loose./to loosen the reins only to grasp them better
charm/fascination/glamor/charisma
(coll.) to keep sb in suspense/to tantalize/to keep on tenterhooks
to announce publicly/to explain oneself/to reveal one's feelings/to confess/to declare one's love
